poem:
**Interference**

In the mosaic of pixels, 
Renee's eyes sift the whirlwind— 
Russian whispers, data dust 
blown through Senate halls.

Truth, a flicker on the screen,
twined with shadows of deceit,
shapes the hand 
that marks the ballot.

Her fingers trace 
the tangled webs—
a landscape crosshatched 
in digital ink.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Online manipulation expert Renée DiResta: ‘Conspiracy theories shape our politics in extremely mainstream ways’ Renée DiResta is a writer and researcher into online manipulation. In 2018, she led a US Senate investigation into the activities of the Russian Internet Research Agency and in 2019 she joined the Stanford Internet Observatory – a non-partisan project to analyse online disinformation. In June this year, after a Republican-led investigation, her contract, along with those of many other staffers,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
